Performing Copy-to-Target Operations

You can copy the source object in entirety to the target object by selecting an object from the right pane that is one type higher than the object selected from the left pane. The hierarchy from top to bottom is server to project to view to folder.

When a view is selected in both the source and the target, the source view can be copied to the target view as a child of the target view. When a folder is selected in both the source and the target, the source folder can be copied to the target folder as a child of the target folder.

After the copy operation completes, the copied object has the same working folders in both the source and the target locations. You may need to change the working folders for one of the locations.

To include a view's child views with the copy or to include a folder's child folders with the copy, you must select the Include child views or Include folder views check box on the General tab of the Options dialog.

To run a copy-to-target operation:

  1. Make a complete backup of the target server configuration and its databases, repositories, and so on. See the StarTeam Administrator's Guide for backup information.

  2. From View Manager, select the source and target objects. See Selecting Source and Target Objects.

  3. Set options for the operation you want to perform. See Selecting View Manager Options.

  4. Do one of the following:

    • Select Run > Copy-to-Target from the menu bar.

    • Click the Copy-to-Target button on the toolbar.

  5. Review the confirmation dialog that appears, which reminds you not to run View Manager without making current server backups. The target server is the only server that is changed by a copy-to-target operation.

  6. Click Review Options to review your option settings and be certain that you have made the correct choices.

  7. If you have the appropriate backups and option settings, click Run. Progress bars appear. You can cancel the operation, but changes that happen before you cancel cannot be undone.

  8. Assess the results by examining the data in the lower pane.
